meanings.definition: To gather or collect in a mass or pile.
meanings.sent1: She amas her toys in a neat pile.
meanings.sent2: The children amas colorful leaves during autumn.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel amas nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds amas ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: He amas his thoughts before making a decision.

meanings.definition: A large amount or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: There was an amas of books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The garden had an amas of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent3: The party had an amas of delicious food.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest held an amas of gold coins.
meanings.sent5: The store had an amas of colorful balloons for sale.
